sections.heading: What is 〜が?
sections.content:
が as a connector means "but" or "however," joining two clauses within the same sentence to show mild contrast or contradiction. It's more formal and softer than でも or けど, making it common in polite speech and written Japanese. This が is different from the subject-marking particle が.

高いですが、買います。 "It's expensive, but I'll buy it." 難しいが、やってみる。 "It's difficult, but I'll try."

children.heading: [Clause 1] が [Clause 2]
children.content: 疲れましたが、頑張ります。 "I'm tired, but I'll do my best." Within single sentence Connects two clauses

children.heading: Mild contrast
children.content: 忙しいが、行く。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." 寒いですが、散歩します。 "It's cold, but I'll take a walk." Soft contradiction

children.heading: Polite disagreement
children.content: 分かりますが、賛成できません。 "I understand, but I can't agree." Cushions opposition

children.heading: Adding contrasting information
children.content: 日本語は難しいが、面白い。 "Japanese is difficult, but interesting." Balanced statement

children.heading: ですが/ますが (polite)
children.content: 高いですが、買います。 "It's expensive, but I'll buy it." 行きますが、遅れます。 "I'll go, but I'll be late." Formal, polite

children.heading: が (casual)
children.content: 高いが、買う。 "It's expensive, but I'll buy it." 忙しいが、行く。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." Neutral to formal

children.heading: Making requests
children.content: すみませんが、ちょっといいですか。 "Excuse me, but may I have a moment?" 恐れ入りますが、お願いします。 "I'm sorry to trouble you, but please..." Softening requests

children.heading: Business/formal speech
children.content: 理解しておりますが、少々お時間をいただけますか。 "I understand, but could I have a little time?" Polite cushioning

children.heading: Giving opinions
children.content: いい考えだと思いますが、問題もあります。 "I think it's a good idea, but there are also problems." Balanced view

children.heading: が = softer, formal
children.content: 忙しいですが、行きます。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." Polite, within sentence

children.heading: でも = casual, separate sentence
children.content: 忙しい。でも行く。 "I'm busy. But I'll go." Conversational

children.heading: けど = casual, within sentence
children.content: 忙しいけど、行く。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." Casual conversation

children.heading: Cushioning statements
children.content: すみませんが... "Excuse me, but..." 申し訳ありませんが... "I'm sorry, but..." Polite preface

children.heading: Polite questions
children.content: よろしいですが、質問があります。 "It's fine, but I have a question." 承知しましたが、確認させてください。 "I understand, but let me confirm." Formal inquiries

children.heading: Uncertain contrast
children.content: 行きたいですが、時間があるかどうか... "I want to go, but whether I have time..." Showing reservation

children.heading: Academic/business
children.content: 研究は進んでいるが、課題も残っている。 "Research is progressing, but challenges remain." 効果は認められるが、さらなる検証が必要だ。 "The effect is acknowledged, but further verification is needed." Formal texts

children.heading: Connects two clauses
children.content: [Clause 1] が、[Clause 2] Can have comma after が Within same sentence

children.heading: With negative clauses
children.content: 好きではありませんが、食べます。 "I don't like it, but I'll eat it." 分かりませんが、やってみます。 "I don't understand, but I'll try." Negative contrasts

children.heading: Sequential contrasts
children.content: 難しいが、面白いが、時間がかかる。 Less natural with multiple が Better to vary connectors

children.heading: Using が too casually
children.content: Unnatural in casual speech: 腹減ったが、我慢する ⚠️ More natural: 腹減ったけど、我慢する ✓ "I'm hungry, but I'll endure." が sounds stiff

children.heading: Confusing with subject が
children.content: Subject: 私が行く "I will go" (subject marker) Connector: 忙しいが、行く "I'm busy, but I'll go" (but) Different functions

children.heading: Polite declining
children.content: ありがとうございますが、結構です。 "Thank you, but I'm fine." 残念ですが、行けません。 "It's unfortunate, but I can't go." Cushions rejection

children.heading: すみませんが
children.content: すみませんが、もう一度お願いします。 "Excuse me, but please (say it) once more." Common polite phrase

children.heading: 申し訳ありませんが
children.content: 申し訳ありませんが、お断りします。 "I'm sorry, but I must decline." Very polite refusal

children.heading: が for transition
children.content: 先日お話ししましたが、あの件について... "As I mentioned the other day, about that matter..." Transitioning topic

children.heading: Formal narratives
children.content: 彼は努力したが、成功しなかった。 "He tried hard, but didn't succeed." Literary style

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 高いですが、買います。 "It's expensive, but I'll buy it." 疲れましたが、頑張ります。 "I'm tired, but I'll do my best." 難しいが、やってみる。 "It's difficult, but I'll try." 分かりますが、できません。 "I understand, but I can't do it." すみませんが、ちょっといいですか。 "Excuse me, but do you have a moment?"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 日本語の勉強は難しいですが、とても 面白いです。毎日少しずつ続けて いれば、必ず上達します。 "Studying Japanese is difficult, but very interesting. If you continue little by little every day, you'll definitely improve." ご提案はありがたいのですが、今回は 見送らせていただきます。また機会が ありましたら、よろしくお願いします。 "I'm grateful for your proposal, but I'll pass this time. If there's another opportunity, please (consider me)." 天気は悪いですが、予定通り出発します。 雨が強くなったら、途中で引き返す かもしれません。 "The weather is bad, but we'll depart as planned. If the rain gets stronger, we might turn back midway."
